summary_reasoning: The report demonstrates good quality assumptions across most dimensions. Key assumptions are explicit and well-justified with multi-year history and peer context. The analyst provides specific forecasts with clear units and time horizons (7% compound annual revenue growth through fiscal 2029, iPhone revenue growth of 6%, services growth of 10%, wearables growth of 13%). Gross margins are projected to rise from 46% to 49% by fiscal 2029, with operating margins reaching 35%. The DCF model includes detailed Stage II parameters (8% EBI growth rate, 2% investment rate) and valuation drivers (9% cost of equity, 8.9% WACC). However, the report lacks quantified sensitivity analysis or scenario testing for material drivers, which caps the grade at Good despite otherwise strong assumption quality.

assumptions_extracted.quote: We project 7% compound annual revenue growth for Apple through fiscal 2029
we project 6% growth for iPhone revenue over the next five years
We forecast gross margins to rise to 49% in fiscal 2029, up from 46% in fiscal 2024
Operating margins rise almost exclusively due to gross margin expansion in our forecast, reaching 35% in fiscal 2029 from 32% in fiscal 2024
